messages.content: What is the overview of the cdxgen server usage?
The user invokes the /sbom endpoint and the cdxgen server responds with the SBOM.
How do I run cdxgen as a server?
Invoke cdxgen with the --server argument: cdxgen --server. By default, it listens to port 9090, which can be customized with the arguments --server-host and --server-port.
How do I run the cdxgen server using the container image?
Run the command docker run --rm -v /tmp:/tmp -p 9090:9090 -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen -r /app --server --server-host 0.0.0.0.
Where can I view the cdxgen server API specification?
View the latest cdxgen server API specification online via Swagger Editor.
How can arguments be passed to the cdxgen server?
Arguments can be passed either via the query string or as a JSON body.
What arguments can be passed to the cdxgen server?

The following arguments are supported: type, multiProject, requiredOnly, noBabel, installDeps, projectId, projectName, projectGroup, projectVersion, parentUUID, serverUrl, apiKey, specVersion, filter, only, autoCompositions, gitBranch, lifecycle, deep, profile, exclude, includeFormulation, includeCrypto, and standard.
What is the purpose of the type argument in server mode?
It specifies the project type. Supports passing multiple types separated by ,. For example, dotnet java.
What is the purpose of the multiProject argument in server mode?
It's a boolean value to specify multiProject.
What is the purpose of the requiredOnly argument in server mode?
It's a boolean to include only the packages with the required scope on the SBOM.
What is the purpose of the noBabel argument in server mode?
It's a boolean to specify to not use babel to perform usage analysis for JavaScript/TypeScript projects.
What is the purpose of the installDeps argument in server mode?
It's a boolean to specify whether to install dependencies automatically for some projects. Defaults to true but disabled for containers and oci scans.
What is the purpose of the projectId argument in server mode?
The UUID of the project. You must provide the UUID or the projectName and projectVersion (or all three).
What is the purpose of the projectName argument in server mode?
Dependency Track project name. Default use the directory name.
What is the purpose of the projectGroup argument in server mode?
Dependency Track project group.
What is the purpose of the projectVersion argument in server mode?
Dependency Track project version. The default is an empty string.
What is the purpose of the parentUUID argument in server mode?
UUID of the parent project.
What is the purpose of the serverUrl argument in server mode?
URL to the Dependency Track API server.
What is the purpose of the apiKey argument in server mode?
API key for the Dependency Track API server.
What is the purpose of the specVersion argument in server mode?
CycloneDX Specification version to use. Default: 1.5.
What is the purpose of the filter argument in server mode?
Filter components containing this word in purl. Multiple values allowed.
What is the purpose of the only argument in server mode?
Include components only containing this word in purl. Useful to generate BOM with first party components alone. Multiple values allowed.
What is the purpose of the autoCompositions argument in server mode?
Automatically set compositions when the BOM was filtered.
What is the purpose of the gitBranch argument in server mode?
Git branch used when cloning the repository. If not specified, it will use the default branch assigned to the repository.
What is the purpose of the lifecycle argument in server mode?
Product lifecycle for the generated BOM. Choices are pre-build, build, post-build.
What is the purpose of the deep argument in server mode?
Perform deep searches for components. Useful while scanning C/C++ apps, live OS and oci images.
What is the purpose of the profile argument in server mode?
BOM profile to use for generation. Default generic. Choices are appsec, research.
What is the purpose of the exclude argument in server mode?
Additional global pattern(s) to ignore. [array]
What is the purpose of the includeFormulation argument in server mode?
Generate formulation section with git metadata and build tools. Use with caution, since there is a risk of exposure of sensitive data such as secrets.
What is the purpose of the includeCrypto argument in server mode?
Include crypto libraries as components. Useful for generating CBOM.
What is the purpose of the standard argument in server mode?

The list of standards which may consist of regulations, industry or organizational-specific standards, maturity models, best practices, or any other requirements which can be evaluated against or attested to. Choices are asvs-4.0.3, bsimm-v13, masvs-2.0.0, nist_ssdf-1.1,pcissc-secure-slc-1.1, scvs-1.0.0, ssaf-DRAFT-2023-11.
How do I scan a local path using the cdxgen server?
curl http://127.0.0.1:9090/sbom?path=/Volumes/Work/sandbox/vulnerable-aws-koa-app&multiProject=true&type=js
How do I scan a Git repository using the cdxgen server?
curl http://127.0.0.1:9090/sbom?url=https://github.com/HooliCorp/vulnerable-aws-koa-app.git&multiProject=true&type=js
How do I pass credentials to authenticate when scanning a Git repo with the cdxgen server?

curl http://127.0.0.1:9090/sbom?url=https://<access_token>@github.com/some/repo.git&multiProject=true&type=js or curl http://127.0.0.1:9090/sbom?url=https://<username>:<password>@bitbucket.org/some/repo.git&multiProject=true&type=js
How can I POST arguments to the cdxgen server?
curl -H "Content-Type: application/json" http://localhost:9090/sbom -XPOST -d $'{"url": "https://github.com/HooliCorp/vulnerable-aws-koa-app.git", "type": "nodejs", "multiProject": "true"}'
Give an example of using requests.post in Python

python
import requests
data = {
 "url": f"https://user:{github_api_key}@github.com/{organization}/{repository}.git",
 "serverUrl": dependencytrack_api_url,
 "apiKey": dependencytrack_api_key
 "projectId": project_uuid,
 "projectName": project_name,
 "projectVersion": project_version,
 "parentUUID": parent_uuid
}
response = requests.post(url=cdxgen_server_url, json=data, allowed_retries=0)
How do I check if the cdxgen server is running?
Use the /health endpoint: curl "http://127.0.0.1:9090/health".
How do I use the docker-compose file?

Run the following commands:

shell
git clone https://github.com/cyclonedx/cdxgen.git
docker compose up
